New Records: Victor Wembanyama scored his first career 50-piece in a 139-130 win over the Washington Wizards.
Key Match Events: Wemby hunted his shot more aggressively than ever, launching five 3s in just five and a half first-quarter minutes.
He finished the contest with eight made 3s on 16 attempts, his third straight game with at least six made deep balls and the most 3-point attempts in a game in his career.
Pre-Game Insights: The Spurs’ plan is to have Wembanyama shoot a high volume of 3s, with Gregg Popovich stating that he wants Wembanyama to be able to do everything on the court.
Post-Match Reflections: The rest of Wembanyama’s repertoire slotted into place behind his pillowy 3-pointer, allowing him to score over, around, and then through Washington’s defense.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wembanyama's 50-point outburst brings his season-long 3-point percentage to a respectable 34 percent, a tick up from his mark last year.
He's averaging more 3s per game than any other center, and is shooting nearly three 3s per game more than the Knicks' Karl-Anthony Towns.
Others: Wembanyama's shooting struggles earlier this season likely won't be his last, as his game is characterized by a boom-and-bust nature.
